intro: Tetrandra zollingeri, commonly known as Zollinger's tetrandra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
